description.plain:
Noah Lindsey Cyrus (born January 8, 2000) is an American actress and singer. Budding recording artist Noah Cyrus is one to watch for 2017, as her debut single “Make Me (Cry)” went straight to #1 on Spotify’s Viral Global Chart within hours of release and has since surpassed 250 million global audio and video streams.

The introductory song from her forthcoming album NC-17 was met with unanimous praise in the U.S. and abroad, with Dazed calling it a “leftfield pop ballad” and Rolling Stone deeming it an “R&B-tinged pop tearjerker.” Her most recent release and follow up, “Stay Together,” is following suit, and already lining up to be the “song of the summer contender,” according to Idolator and NYLON crowning it as a “warm and cheery anthem of the summer.”

She has also been featured in multiple songs, including “Chasing Colors,” “All Falls Down,” “Slow,” and “My Way.”

songs.full_title: July by Noah Cyrus
songs.title: July

description.plain: “July” is the sixth track and first single on Noah Cyrus' second EP, THE END OF EVERYTHING. It was accompanied by a music video on the same day of the release. The song is about heartbreak and leaving a toxic relationship.

songs.lyrics:
61 ContributorsTranslationsEspañolPortuguêsJuly Lyrics[Verse 1]
I've been holding my breath
I've  been counting to ten
Over  something you said
I've been holding back tears
While you're throwing back beers
I'm  alone in bed

[Pre-Chorus]
You  know I, I'm afraid of change
Guess that's why we stay the same
[Chorus]
So  tell me to leave
I'll pack my bags, get on the road
Find someone that loves you
Better than I do, darling, I know
'Cause  you remind me every day
I'm not enough, but I still stay

[Verse 2]
Feels like a lifetime
Just tryna get by
While we're dying inside
I've done a lot of things wrong
Loving you being one
But I can't move on

[Pre-Chorus]
You know I, I'm afraid of change
Guess that's why we stay the same

[Chorus]
So tell me to leave
I'll pack my bags, get on the road
Find someone that loves you
Better than I do, darling, I know
'Cause you remind me every day
I'm not enough, but I still stay
You might also like[Bridge]
If you want me to leave
Then tell me to leave and, baby I'll go

[Outro]
You remind me every day
I'm not enough, but I still stay51Embed

songs.full_title: Again by Noah Cyrus (Ft. XXXTENTACION)
songs.title: Again

description.plain:
“Again” received considerable controversy, considering the involvement of rapper and alleged domestic abuser, XXXTENTACION.

Despite this, “Again” makes for a smooth and dream-like pop duet, in which X becomes the latest in the hip-hop trend of recording a song entirely sung.

songs.full_title: Make Me (Cry) by Noah Cyrus (Ft. Labrinth)
songs.title: Make Me (Cry)

description.plain:
Noah Cyrus and Labrinth’s “Make Me (Cry)” is about struggling to move past an unhealthy relationship. The song is Noah Cyrus’ debut single, after signing a $350,000 record deal in 2016.

This wasn’t Cyrus’ first time in the studio, though. She sang the theme song for Disney’s Ponyo with Frankie Jonas in 2009—she also voiced the title role in the English version of the animated film.

Noah Cyrus talked about working on her music and her budding career to Paper Magazine earlier this year:

My dad always had me sing alongside him while he played guitar. He taught me how to harmonize to an old song of his, “Missing You”. Writing is the best way to get your mind clear.  It’s also a great way to explain your past or what you hope for the future.

The song follows a slower beat with a theme revolving around toxic love and heartbreak. Her raspy vocals compliments the sound as she teams up with U.K. singer and producer Labrinth.
